reviewText: This movie is the very-top-of-the-line in horse-movie-entertainment! I would like to see it remastered digimaticaly in DVD. Ward Bond and all are superb in this light-hearted movie for children of all ages; that's right, for adults too!, especially!Moreover, I would also like to see "Another Man, Another Chance" (the English title) with James Caan and G. Bujold also remastered into an English DVD! It is a superb movie, just bleep out the first two or three minutes with the nonsensical swear words, totally unnessasary, unwarranted and unneeded; the movie carries itself with extremely fine acting. I understand that the French version, "Another Man, Another Woman" is in DVD; it is one of the finest westerns, by a French Director, at least one French actress and the violence and western folklore is foretold in an incredibly delightful way. I want an English copy on DVD! I am a western DVD collector and rate this above mentioned flix along with "Lonesome Dove" . . . "True Grit" . . . "Tombstone" . . . "Wyatt Earp" . . . "Unforgiven" . . . "The Longriders" . . . "Pat Garrett and Billy the Kid" . . . "Outlaw Josey Wells"; except, the Frenchman does it with less blood and guts--I can live with it as it's done nicely and it's not left out--imagination--that's the key. The lovely G. Bujold, with her original French-Canadian accent is and sounds lovely, absolutely a French doll--forgive me Sussanne Pleshette and Claudine Longet.AG Potts.
summary: Gypsy Colt VHS,  wish it were a DVD; more westerns
Title: N/A

reviewText: Gypsy Colt [VHS]In 1951 I got my hearts desire, a Pony. Her name was Lady. Spring of 1953 she had a little Filly (Shetland) and I named her Gypsy Colt. I had seen the movie of Gypsy Colt and was so moved by the story, I never forgot it. Not even today, it always remained my favorite Horse movie. I was 12 yr old when "my" Gypsy Colt was born. My parents seperated in 1953 and divorced in 1954. In 1971 I was reunited with both Lady and Gypsy. By then I was married and had two children. My daughter learned to ride on Gypsy Colt-bareback. I still had Gypsy in the early 1980's. The movie of Gypsy Colt was such a moving, sad and then happy ending, story. Gypsy Colt loved that little girl so much, nothing could keep him from her, and his love was returned ten fold by Meg. Gypsy was a beautiful Black Stallion with some white on his pasterns. That coloring has always been my favorite, black with the white markings on his legs. I wish it could be bought in DVD. It was a wonderful story and carried so much heart felt meaning. Any child who loves horses or animals would love it and never forget it. Today I am 69 year old and have a black/bay Arabian Gelding with white on his face and a couple legs. He fulfilled all my dreams in color and breed. I wish they still made movies like Gypsy Colt. I place The Black Stallion movies right up there with Gypsy. The bond of Love between a horse and human.
Title: N/A

reviewerName: Beth DeRoos "Beth DeRoos from the California ...
reviewText: Yes, this is a movie any horse lover should own. But the value goes well beyond the love of horses and to the issues of faith, family love and common decency.  And what a great story about a horse who knows who really loves him as he tries at every turn to escape from his cruel trainer.  Great ending that also demonstrates decency and ethics as the original owner sees what is going on and that the horse belongs where the girl and her family live.  And the faith issue comes in because the girl had such faith that doing what was right would bring blessings. Blessings such as an end to a drought, her father being able to keep the money he got for selling the horse in order to buy seed, and blessings in knowing that good can win in the end.1o star
Title: N/A

reviewText: Written by the same author, Eric Knight, Gypsy Colt is very similar to Lassie Come Home, however it is enjoyable anyway, even if we know the plot in advance.Highland Dale, known as Beaut but credited as Gypsy was a black American Saddlebred stallion who also starred in the TV series Fury. Wonderfully trained, he is not only gorgeous but so entertaining to watch. He is the star of this movie for sure. He steals every scene he is in. What a horse he was!
summary: It's Lassie Come Home with a girl and a horse
Title: N/A

reviewText: I had a horse when I was 18, and my folks sold him because they could not afford horse shoes and shoes for four children, too.The man who bought my horse tried to get him to eat, but he starved himself and the new owner buried him in the pasture.I believe my horse, named Tarzan, died of a broken heart.  He had been a circus horse, knew all sorts of tricks, and was a sweet, loving animal, more pet than anything.  I like this movie of Gypsy Colt, it brought back memories of a wonderful horse.
Title: N/A

reviewerName: Staci L. Wilson "Author: Animal Movies Guide ...
reviewText: It's Lassie as a horse, young Joe Carraclough as a girl, and bonnie England traded in for the American West... But the story (based on Eric Knight's Lassie Come Home novel) remains the same: Child finds pet; child loves pet; child loses pet; pet goes on an arduous journey; child and pet are reunited. Despite the lack of originality in the story, it is very well done here and the horse, Gypsy (played by Highland Dale, credited as Gypsy), is not only stunningly beautiful, he's a very talented actor to boot. In the end, Gypsy outdoes Lassie when he brings a miracle home with him.Staci Layne Wilson
Title: N/A
